constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 35 (Wednesday, February 24, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. GOHMERT:
H.R. 1293.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article I, Section 4, Clause 1:
The Times, Places and Manner of holding Elections for
Senators and Representatives, shall be prescribed in each
State by the Legislature thereof; but the Congress may at any
time by Law make or alter such Regulations, except as to the
Places of chusing Senators.
[Page H617]

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

title: To amend the Help America Vote Act of 2002 to prohibit a State from counting a ballot cast in an election for Federal office which is received by the State after the date of the election.
